group_1.textCenter: (I finally made it. This is the cooking@class...)

group_1.textLeft: All right, everybody. Hello there!
I'm your cooking instructor for today,@Manaka Kurumi!
It's lovely to meet you!

group_1.textRight: (Oh my... Our teacher is very young.)
(The same age as Hazuki, perhaps?@Hopefully older than Ayame...)
(Though I suppose Ayame is rather@immature for her age.)
My name is Konoha Shizumi. Pleased to@meet you, Manaka-sensei.

group_1.textLeft: Konoha! Great to meet you! So, do you@cook often?

group_1.textRight: No... I recently decided that I needed@to learn, that's all.
Any time I make anything it's always@completely vile. You wouldn't believe it.

group_1.textLeft: Don't worry. I'll teach you!
I just know that you can make a delicious@dish if you try, Konoha!

group_1.textRight: Y-yes, of course! Thank you! Please@teach me!

group_1.textLeft: Okay, so let's start from the basics.
Handling a knife!
In order to serve the freshest and@tastiest food you can...
You must cut in a way that highlights @taste, without any waste.
Food changes depending on whether you@you cut along the grain or against it.
That way, we can control the food's texture.

group_1.textRight: Ah, yes! This is where "texture selection"@comes into play!

group_1.textLeft: Y...Yes! That's one way of putting it.
Okay, so now I'd like everybody to copy@how I cut with the knife!
Ah, no! Cutting like that damages the@grain.
Hold it carefully, line it up, and...
[chara:300902:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]...!
N-no, that's not right!
Umm, how about we try something else?
Let's practice cracking an egg!

group_1.textRight: Ah! The entire shell went in...

group_1.textLeft: Try striking one egg against another!
That causes the one with the thinner@shell to crack just right.
(I've...never seen both eggs crack when@using that technique before!)
Umm, well, let's see... How can I best@teach you...

group_1.textRight: [chara:302601:effect_emotion_sad_0][se:7224_fall_into]Manaka-sensei, I'm not confident that@I can do this...

group_1.textLeft: No...! There's still lots to try!
I WILL help you improve!
